snippet: Two Florida doctors who received the nation’s highest Medicare reimbursements in 2012 are both major contributors to Democratic Party causes.
abstract: Health and Human Services Dept report shows that Florida doctors Salomon Melgen and Asad Qamar, who received the nation's highest Medicare reimbursements in 2012, are both major contributors to Democratic Party causes; Melgen and Qamar, subjects of investigations for fraudulent billing, defend their payments, citing unique conditions at their practices.

byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and ERIC LIPTON
byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Miami, and Eric Lipton from Washington. Michael Strickland contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Two Florida doctors who received the nation’s highest Medicare reimbursements in 2012 are both major contributors to Democratic Party causes.

headline.main: Political Ties of Top Billers for Medicare
headline.print_headline: Political Ties of Top Billers for Medicare
